abstract: Jamie Dimon, the chief executive of JPMorgan Chase, has left the board of the Federal Reserve Bank of New York after his second three-year term expired at the end of December.
snippet: Jamie Dimon, the chief executive of JPMorgan Chase, has left the board of the Federal Reserve Bank of New York after his second three-year term expired at the end of December.
lead_paragraph: Jamie Dimon, the chief executive of JPMorgan Chase, has left the board of the Federal Reserve Bank of New York, a position that had stirred some controversy after the bank’s big trading loss last year.

headline.main: Dimon Leaves New York Fed Board as His Term Ends

keywords.name: organizations
